meanings.definition: A member of an ancient Roman priesthood responsible for conducting rituals related to declaring war and making treaties.
meanings.sent1: The fetials performed important ceremonies in ancient Rome.
meanings.sent2: The fetials were respected for their role in maintaining peace.
meanings.sent3: The fetials accidentally spilled the sacred water during the ceremony, causing a commotion.
meanings.sent4: The presence of the fetials added a sense of solemnity to the treaty signing.
meanings.sent5: The colorful robes of the fetials stood out in the crowd, symbolizing their sacred duty.

meanings.definition: Of or relating to the fetials or their duties.
meanings.sent1: The treaty was signed with all the necessary fetial formalities.
meanings.sent2: The fetial traditions were passed down through generations.
meanings.sent3: The room was decorated in a fetial style, with ancient symbols adorning the walls.
meanings.sent4: Her voice had a fetial tone, commanding attention and respect.
meanings.sent5: The fetial influence could be seen in the meticulous preparation for the ceremony.
